name: Cinnamon
description: Warm, sweet spice used in baking and savory dishes.

name: Ginger
description: Aromatic spice used in Asian and Indian cuisine.

name: Turmeric
description: Bright yellow spice with anti-inflammatory properties.

name: Cumin
description: Earthy and warm spice used in Mexican and Indian cuisine.

name: Coriander
description: Slightly citrusy flavor, used in many cuisines.

name: Paprika
description: Mild to hot chili powder, adds color and flavor.

name: Chili Powder
description: Spicy blend of chili peppers and other spices.

name: Cayenne Pepper
description: Very hot chili pepper, adds intense heat.

name: Garlic Powder
description: Dried and ground garlic, adds savory flavor.

name: Onion Powder
description: Dried and ground onion, adds savory flavor.

name: Oregano
description: Aromatic herb, commonly used in Italian cuisine.

name: Basil
description: Aromatic herb, often used in Italian cuisine.

name: Rosemary
description: Woody and flavorful herb, often used in roasting.

name: Thyme
description: Aromatic herb, often used in soups and stews.

name: Parsley
description: Fresh or dried herb, used as garnish and in many dishes.

name: Bay Leaves
description: Aromatic leaves used in soups, stews, and stocks.

name: Nutmeg
description: Nutty and slightly sweet spice, used in baking and savory dishes.

name: Cloves
description: Strong, pungent spice used in baking and savory dishes.

name: Cardamom
description: Aromatic and slightly sweet spice, often used in Indian cuisine.

name: Star Anise
description: Aromatic star-shaped spice used in Asian cuisine.

name: Fennel
description: Licorice-flavored spice, used in Italian sausage and other dishes.

name: Mustard Seeds
description: Used in Indian, Middle Eastern, and European cuisines.

name: Black Pepper
description: Commonly used spice, adds heat and flavor to dishes.

name: White Pepper
description: Milder than black pepper, often used in lighter-colored dishes.

name: Allspice
description: Aromatic spice with a blend of cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves flavors.
